Detailed Description

This class defines a point in two dimension.

Since
0.3.1

Definition at line 20 of file point.hpp.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Point::Point ( )
inline

The default constructor, returning the frame origin (0,0).

Definition at line 26 of file point.hpp.

Point::Point ( const double &  x,
const double &  y 
)
inline

The main constructor, creating a point from its Cartesian coordinates.

The point of Polar coordinates (r, theta) can be obtained using the formula Point().translate(v), where v is the vector of Polar coordinates (rho, theta).

Parameters
xthe first Cartesian coordinate of the point,
ythe second Cartesian coordinate of the point.
See also
xCoord, yCoord, Vector.

Definition at line 41 of file point.hpp.

Member Function Documentation

double Point::distance ( const Point &  other) const
inline

Gives the distance between two points.

It simply computes the length of the connecting vector.

Parameters
otheranother point.
Returns
the distance between the two points.
See also
operator-(const iSeeML::geom::Point&), Vector::length.

const double &  y 
)
inline

Moves the point to a given position.

The original point is changed.

Parameters

the point, after tranformation.

inline

Difference operator between two points, giving the vector connecting these points.

Parameters

Returns
the vector going from the second given point to the first one (the current).

inline

Gives the square of the distance between two points.

It simply computes the square length of the connecting vector.

Definition at line 164 of file point.hpp.

Point& Point::translate ( const Vector &  v)
inline

Translates the point along a vector.

The original point is changed (addition without modification is obtained using operator+(const iSeeML::geom::Vector&) const).

Parameters
vthe vector of the translation.
Returns
the point, after translation.
